Detailed Description

The section has a list of all internal API which are not exposed to the external applications.

Function Documentation

static void MMWave_asyncEventHandler ( uint8_t  devIndex,
uint16_t  sbId,
uint16_t  sbLen,
uint8_t *  payload 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function which is used to handle asynchronous events which are received from the BSS.

Parameters
[in]devIndexDevice Index
[in]sbIdSubblock identifier
[in]sbLenLength of the subblock
[in]payloadPointer to the payload buffer
Return values
Notapplicable
int32_t MMWave_closeLink ( MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to close the mmWave Link module.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the control MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static rlInt32_t MMWave_computeCRC ( rlUInt8_t *  ptrData,
rlUInt32_t  dataLen,
rlUInt8_t  crcType,
rlUInt8_t *  crc 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to compute the CRC for the specified data buffer.

Parameters
[in]ptrDataPointer to the data buffer for which the CRC is to be computed
[in]dataLenLength of the data buffer for which the CRC is to be computed
[in]crcTypeCRC Type i.e. 16bit, 32bit or 64bit.
[out]crcComputed CRC
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

MMWave_CtrlCfg *  ptrControlCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

The function is used to configure BPM

Parameters

[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Return values

Error- <0
static int32_t MMWave_configureProfileChirp ( MMWave_ProfileHandle *  ptrProfileHandle,
int32_t *  errCode 
)
static

Description
The function is used to configure the mmWave link with the specified profile and corresponding chirp configuration. The following order is preserved in the function:

  • Profile configuration
  • Chirp configuration
Parameters
[in]ptrProfileHandlePointer to profile handle
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to power off and disable the XWR1XX device

Parameters
[in]deviceIndexDevice index which is to be disabled
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

static void MMWave_internalLinkSync ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
uint32_t  flag 
)
static

Description
The function is used to perform an internal synchronization waiting for the specific flag to be set. The function will loop around until the condition is met

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the control MCB
[in]flagFlag for which we are synchronizing
Return values
Notapplicable
static void MMWave_maskHostIRQ ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to mask the interrupts. Since the mmWave control module is using the Mailbox communication interface the driver is handling all the interrupt management. This function is a dummy stub.

Parameters
[in]fdHandle to the communication interface
Return values
Notapplicable
static void MMWave_mboxCallbackFxn ( Mbox_Handle  handle,
Mailbox_Type  remoteEndpoint 
)
static

Description
This is the registered callback function which is invoked when the Mailbox receives data.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the Mailbox on which data was received
[in]remoteEndpointRemote endpoint from which data was received
Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t MMWave_mboxClose ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to close the communication interface channel

Parameters
[in]fdOpaque Handle to the communication channel which is to be closed
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static rlComIfHdl_t MMWave_mboxOpen ( rlUInt8_t  deviceIndex,
uint32_t  flags 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to open the communication interface channel

Parameters
[in]deviceIndexDevice index for which the communication channel to be opened
[in]flagsFlags which are passed to configure the interface
Return values
Success- Communicate Interface Channel Handle
Error- NULL
static int32_t MMWave_mboxRead ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd,
uint8_t *  pBuff,
uint16_t  len 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to read data from the communication interface channel

Parameters
[in]fdOpaque Handle to the communication channel
[out]pBuffPointer to the data buffer which is populated with the received message
[in]lenSize of the data buffer
Return values
Success- Number of bytes of received data
Error- <0
static int32_t MMWave_mboxWrite ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd,
uint8_t *  pBuff,
uint16_t  len 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to write data to the communication interface channel

Parameters
[in]fdOpaque Handle to the communication channel
[in]pBuffPointer to the data buffer which is to be written out
[in]lenSize of the data buffer
Return values
Success- Number of bytes of data which is sent
Error- <0
int32_t MMWave_openLink ( MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
rlCalibrationData_t *  ptrCalibData,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to open the mmWave Link module.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the control MCB
[in]ptrCalibDataOptional pointer to the calibration data which needs to be restored.
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
rlInt32_t MMWave_osalMutexCreate ( rlOsiMutexHdl_t *  mutexHandle,
rlInt8_t *  name 
)

Description
This is the mmWave link registered OSAL function which is used to create a mutex.

Parameters
[out]mutexHandleHandle to the mutex object which is to be created
[in]nameName of the mutex object
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
rlInt32_t MMWave_osalMutexDelete ( rlOsiMutexHdl_t *  mutexHandle)

Description
This is the mmWave link registered OSAL function which is used to delete the mutex

Parameters
[in]mutexHandleHandle to the mutex object
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

rlOsiTime_t  timeout 
)

Parameters

rlInt32_t MMWave_osalSemWait ( rlOsiSemHdl_t *  semHandle,
rlOsiTime_t  timeout 
)

Parameters

[in]timeoutMaximum timeout to wait for the semaphore
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static rlInt32_t MMWave_registerInterruptHandler ( rlUInt8_t  deviceIndex,
RL_P_EVENT_HANDLER  pHandler,
void *  pValue 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to register the interrupt handler. In the case of the Mailbox the driver is responsible for the interrupt management. This function is a dummy stub

Parameters
[in]deviceIndexDevice for which the interrupt is to be registered
[in]pHandlerISR Handler
[in]pValueArgument to the ISR
Return values
Alwaysreturns 0
static rlInt32_t MMWave_spawn ( RL_P_OSI_SPAWN_ENTRY  fxn,
const void *  pValue,
uint32_t  flags 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function which is invoked to ensure that the spawn function is invoked in a different execution context

Parameters
[in]fxnPointer to the function to be executed in a different context
[in]pValuePointer of data to be passed to the function
[in]flagsFlag to indicate preference
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t MMWave_startLink ( MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to start the mmWave link. This function can only be invoked once the configuration has been completed successfully.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the control MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t MMWave_stopLink ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to stop the mmWave link.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the control MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static void MMWave_unmaskHostIRQ ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to unmask the interrupts to indicate that the message has been successfully handled

Parameters
[in]fdHandle to the communication interface
Return values
Notapplicable
static rlInt32_t MMWave_waitIRQStatus ( rlComIfHdl_t  fd,
rlUInt8_t  Level 
)
static

Description
This is the mmWave link registered callback function to poll the host interrupt status. In the case of the Mailbox the driver is responsible for the interrupt management. This function is a dummy stub

Parameters
[in]fdHandle to the communication interface
[in]LevelWait for IRQ Level(high/low)
Return values
Alwaysreturns 0 indicating that the IRQ Line is low
